content: As India celebrates Vinesh Phogat's historic performance at the 2024 Paris Olympics, RTI findings reveal that the investigation into allegations of sexual misconduct against Brij Bhushan Singh remains shrouded in secrecy. In response to an RTI seeking information about the Mary Kom-led oversight committee probing the case, the Sports Ministry claimed, "this information is not available."
title: Sports Ministry has 'no details' of inquiry report on Brij Bhushan

content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Saturday conducted an aerial survey of landslide-affected areas of Kerala's Wayanad. The PM, who also physically visited the affected areas, was accompanied by Kerala Governor Arif Mohammed Khan, Chief Minister Pinarayi Vijayan and Union Minister of State Suresh Gopi. Notably, over 300 people lost their lives after multiple landslides hit Wayanad on July 30.
title: PM Modi conducts aerial survey of landslide-hit areas of Wayanad

content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, joined by CM Pinarayi Vijayan, conducted an aerial survey of Wayanad's landslide-hit areas, focusing on Iruvazhinji Puzha, Punchiri Mattam, Mundakkai, and Chooralmala. PM Modi then visited affected sites, met with victims, and reviewed relief and rehabilitation efforts to ensure effective support.
title: PM Modi carries out aerial survey of disaster-hit areas of Wayanad

content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited landslide-affected Wayanad to review relief efforts. He conducted an aerial survey, visited disaster sites, and met with victims at relief camps and hospitals. PM Modi was joined by Kerala's Governor and Chief Minister. The state government seeks national disaster status for the calamity.
title: PM Modi arrives in Kerala, heads to Wayanad landslide zones

content: The Dakshina Kannada district police are stepping up their fight against the rising tide of cybercrimes. SP Yathish N expressed concern over the increasing number of educated individuals and professionals falling victim to these crimes. To tackle this, the police have launched enhanced awareness campaigns through social media, sharing short videos on cybercrime prevention.
title: DK Police intensify cybercrime awareness and prevention efforts

content: The ICAR-Central Plantation Crops Research Institute has released an advisory to control the spread of arecanut fruit rot, also known as koleroga, which has become more prevalent due to continuous rainfall in certain areas. Farmers who were unable to spray their crops in July are now facing a higher risk of infection, making it crucial to implement control measures.
title: ICAR-CPCRI issues advisory to combat Arecanut fruit rot

content: A resident of Dongerkery has earned widespread praise for her courageous act of capturing and safely rescuing a 9-foot-long python found near the cowshed of Balakrishna Nayak’s house. The incident occurred around 9:30 PM on Tuesday, when the massive snake was spotted near Balakrishna’s barn, sparking concern and fear among the locals who quickly gathered at the scene.
title: Mangaluru woman praised for bravery in rescuing 9-foot python

content: The Cabinet Committee on Economic Affairs has recently approved eight new projects for Indian Railways which will increase the existing rail network by 900 kilometres. The projects will be undertaken in 14 districts in seven states, which include Maharashtra, Odisha, Andhra Pradesh, Jharkhand, Bihar, Telangana and West Bengal. The total cost of the project is estimated at ₹24,657 crore.
title: New Indian Railways projects costing ₹24,000 crore approved

content: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari demanded a CBI inquiry into the death of a 31-year-old postgraduate doctor at Kolkata's RG Kar Medical College, alleging possible murder and rape. He criticizes the state government's inadequate response and urges student protests. The incident has triggered a political uproar in West Bengal.
title: Suvendu Adhikari demands CBI probe in case of woman doctor's death

content: Apollo Diagnostics has launched its 140th processing lab in Kasba, South Kolkata, with a monthly capacity of 25,000 samples. Certified lab doctors and technicians provide expert services to customers. The company has invested ₹250 crore in its business expansion in West Bengal.
title: Apollo Diagnostics invests ₹250 crore in West Bengal

content: Shares of Ola Electric Mobility ended at ₹91.2 on the National Stock Exchange on Friday, 20% higher than the issue price of ₹76 per share. The total market capitalisation of the electric two-wheeler maker is currently ₹40,226.7 crore. Founder Bhavish Aggarwal's net worth doubled to $2.6 billion following the company's stock market debut, as per Bloomberg.
title: Ola Electric shares end 20% higher on market debut

content: The BSE Sensex dropped 582 points, closing at 78,886, while the NSE Nifty50 fell by 180 points to 24,117. Market volatility continues as global cues weigh heavily. The rupee fell to a record low of 83.96 against the dollar, causing concern among market segments. Meanwhile, India's forex reserves reached $675 billion. Consumer product sales slowed sharply due to macroeconomic headwinds.
title: Markets plunge as rupee hits record low, volatility persists

content: Shares of Ola Electric listed on BSE on Friday with no premium. Ola Electric had offered shares in its ₹6,154-crore IPO, which was open between August 2 and August 6, at a price band of ₹72-76, with shares listing on Friday at ₹75.99. The shares, however, rose nearly 17.50% in early trade to hit a high of ₹89.25.
title: Ola Electric shares list with no premium, rise 17.50% in early trade

content: WazirX has announced that it'll undo all trades that its users made from July 18-21 after a ₹1,965-crore security breach. All user portfolios will be restored to their status as on 1:00 pm on July 18, when WazirX halted withdrawals. Any fees or referral earnings will also be reversed while deposited funds will be accounted for in a future update.
title: WazirX to undo all trades made from July 18-21 after ₹1,965-cr hack

content: Sensex opened about 1,100 points higher on Friday, a day after it fell 581.79 points at close on Thursday. Nifty also rose 1.12% higher at 24,386.85 after lower-than-expected US jobless data eased concerns about a looming recession in the US. The top Sensex gainers included Tech Mahindra and Tata Motors while ONGC and Eicher Motors were top the Nifty gainers.
title: Sensex opens 1,100 points higher day after closing 580 points lower

content: FirstCry-parent BrainBees Solutions' ₹4,194-crore IPO was subscribed 12.22 times on the third and the final day of the bidding. The qualified institutional buyers' portion was subscribed 19.3 times, while the retail category was subscribed 2.31 times. The portions reserved for employees and non-institutional investors were subscribed 6.57 times and 4.68 times, respectively.
title: FirstCry's ₹4,194-crore IPO subscribed 12.22 times on last day

content: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, while discussing the tax hike on futures and options (F&O) trading in the Union Budget, said, "I'm not saying middle class shouldn't go into F&O." "But F&O goes with risk," she added. She further stated that SEBI is "very well equipped to take care of" issues related to F&O trading.
title: Not saying middle class shouldn't do F&O, but know the risks: FM

content: SaaS startup Unicommerce eSolutions' ₹277-crore IPO became the second-most subscribed issue this year, NDTV Profit reported. The IPO was subscribed 168.35 times on Thursday, the last day of the bidding. While the non-institutional investors' portion was subscribed 252.46 times, the qualified institutional buyers' category was subscribed 138.75 times. The issue opened on Tuesday.
title: Unicommerce IPO booked 168 times, 2nd highest subscription in 2024

content: Former Infosys CFO, Mohandas Pai, expressed his concerns over the regime. Pai, while quoting another account, tagged the Union Labour Minister, Mansukh Mandaviya, and said, "Minister @mansukhmandviya Please do have a review. They are preventing benefits when people leave." He concluded his post by saying, "After 10 years of NDA, this is not acceptable @narendramodi @PMOIndia @AmitShah."
title: 'After 10 years of NDA...': Mohandas Pai bemoans EPFO woes

content: Shares of Exicom Tele-systems Ltd, India's leading manufacturer of electric vehicle chargers, witnessed renewed buying interest and gained around 4%. This surge was followed by the company's significant announcement. The company's subsidiary, Exicom Power Solutions B.V. Netherlands, along with other step-down subsidiaries, will acquire the business and assets of Tritium Group of Companies.
title: Exicom Tele-systems share witness buying interest; stocks jumps 4%

content: Social media platform Rumble's CEO Chris Pavlovski shared screenshots of an email exchange he claims he had with a Dunkin' Donuts executive. The executive said Dunkin' Donuts wasn't comfortable advertising on Rumble due to "right-wing culture". "No, we don't discriminate. All cultures are welcome on Rumble," Pavlovski said. After his X post went viral, '#BoycottDunkinDonuts' began trending on X.
title: Why is #BoycottDunkinDonuts trending on social media?

content: Colin Huang, Founder of PDD Holdings which owns e-commerce platform Temu and retail app Pinduoduo, has become China's richest person, as per Bloomberg. Huang, who's now worth $48.6 billion, was born in 1980 in Hangzhou and had worked at Google in China. His parents were factory workers. Huang has a master's degree from University of Wisconsin-Madison.
title: Who is Colin Huang, ex-Google staff who is China's richest person?

content: US-based Cisco Systems will reportedly lay off around 4,000 people in its second round of job cuts this year. The Cisco layoffs is initiated as a part of company's cost-cutting strategy and focus on the growth areas like cybersecurity and AI. The first round of layoffs affected around 4,000 Cisco employees in February 2024.
title: Cisco likely laying off over 4,000 employees soon

content: US-based short seller Hindenburg Research, known for its exposé on Adani Group, hinted at another disclosure involving India. In a recent post on X, Hindenburg wrote, "Something big soon India." In January last year, Hindenburg released a report accusing Adani Group of orchestrating "the largest con in corporate history".
title: Something big soon India, tweets Hindenburg Research

content: Marico MD and CEO Saugata Gupta and his wife and banker Reema Sen have purchased an apartment in Mumbai's Worli for ₹36.4 crore, as per documents accessed by Zapkey. The apartment has a carpet area of 3,872 square feet and features five parking spots. The couple paid a stamp duty of ₹2.18 crore and registration charges worth ₹30,000.
title: Marico CEO Gupta, his wife buy apartment in Worli for ₹36.4 crore

content: In an interview with ET, Delhivery CEO Sahil Barua discussed the sustainability of 10-15 minute deliveries, which are viable only for groceries and FMCG. He revealed Delhivery's focus on 2-4 hour deliveries through shared dark stores, avoiding instant deliveries. Despite slow revenue growth, it returned to profitability in April-June and aims to expand its PTL business.
title: Quick commerce is killing kiranas, not e-commerce: Delhivery CEO

content: Indian equity indices closed in the green on Friday following positive sentiment in the markets. At closing, Sensex closed 819 points or 1.04 per cent higher at 79,705 and Nifty closed 250 points or 1.04 per cent higher at 24,367. Domestic market indices showed resilience when the global market fluctuated.
title: Sensex jumps 819 points, auto and IT stocks outshine

content: Shares of GRM Overseas jumped over 10% to ₹224.95 per share from its previous closing. The company has a market cap of over ₹1,300 crore. The stock saw a spurt in volume by more than 2 times. GRM Overseas announced a strategic partnership with Solariz Invest in Morocco. This collaboration introduces its flagship basmati rice brand ‘Tanoush’ to Moroccan consumers.
title: GRM Overseas jumps 10% today; announces strategic partnership

content: Shares of HBL Power Systems Ltd opened at ₹617.95 and during the trading session, the shares hit a high of ₹ 622.65, a 3% gain. Despite a 15 % quarterly revenue decline to ₹520.11 crore, net profits increased by 15%. Year over year, revenue rose by 11 % and net profits surged by 47%.
title: HBL Power Systems net profit increases by 47% YoY

content: JG Chemicals shares surged by 16% to ₹344.70 per share due to the company's impressive Q1 FY25 performance. The company reported net profit of ₹16 crore, remarkable 307% increase compared to the same quarter last year, and total revenue of ₹203 crore, marking an 16.3% growth. JG Chemicals Ltd is India’s largest manufacturer of zinc oxide by production and revenue.
title: JG Chemicals reports 307% YoY increase in net profit

content: BJP MP Anurag Thakur on Friday criticised Congress MP and the Leader of Opposition in Lok Sabha, Rahul Gandhi, for silence over the attacks on Hindus in violence-hit Bangladesh. Speaking in Parliament, Thakur said, "What was the compulsion that he (Rahul) could not speak about the security of the Hindus in Bangladesh? You talk about Gaza but not Bangladesh."
title: Rahul didn't speak about Hindus in B'desh, what's the compulsion: BJP

content: After quitting the ministerial post, Rajasthan BJP leader Kirodi Lal Meena said he resigned from the state cabinet because party leaders didn't give weightage to him. He said, "I gave up the ministerial post in this (Rajasthan CM Bhajanlal Sharma's) government because the people I've been serving for 45 years didn't listen to me." Meena's resignation hasn't been accepted yet.
title: People I served for 45 yrs didn't listen: BJP's Kirodi on resigning

content:
AAP leader Manish Sisodia, who was granted bail by the Supreme Court on Friday, shared a selfie with his wife on Saturday. "Azadi ki subah ki pehli chai (First morning tea of 
Independence) after 17 months!...The freedom that Constitution has given to all of us...as a guarantee of the right to live," he wrote. He was jailed in February 2023.
title: Sisodia shares selfie with wife, says 'Having 1st morning tea of Independence'

content: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi questioned EAM S Jaishankar about the release of 69 Indians who've been "misled" to join the Russian Army. Jaishankar said, "We should not jump the gun and say Russians aren't serious on this matter." He added, "PM Narendra Modi has got President Vladimir Putin's assurance that any Indian...who's in the service of Russian Army will be...released."
title: Owaisi asks EAM about Indians in Russia Army, he says 'Don't jump the gun'

content: Union Minister Kiren Rijiju praised the Parliament session for its productive business transactions. Speaking to reporters, he said, "Neither the Budget session nor the entire Parliament session was washed out even for a single day and we saw...On behalf of all members of the Lok Sabha and Rajya Sabha, I want to thank Chairmen of both Houses for their help."
title: Parliament achieves productive session: Kiren Rijiju

content: Iranian hackers, linked to the government, targeted a high-ranking US presidential campaign official in June, following a county-level breach. Microsoft reports these attacks are part of broader efforts to influence the US election. Iran denies involvement, claiming its cyber activities are defensive and proportionate.
title: Iranian hackers target US officials ahead of election: Microsoft

content: At a recent Budget announcement, FM Nirmala Sitharaman eased regulations for the aviation MRO industry, aiming to turn India into a key hub and promote the transportation sector. Airlines in India have been expanding their aircraft fleet rapidly to meet growing demand in the country. However, the aviation MRO industry in the country has not been able to keep up.
title: India’s aircraft repairs industry needs to catch up

content: South Korean company Samsung's smartphones gifted to North Korean Olympians at Paris Olympics may violate UN Security Council's sanctions against North Korea. The sanctions prohibit supply, sale or transfer of "all industrial machinery" to North Korea. The International Olympics Committee said the North Korean Olympians hadn't received the smartphones. It's unclear where the phones might've went.
title: How may Samsung phones given to N Korean Olympians violate UN sanctions?

content: Speaking after winning bronze medal in the ongoing Paris Olympics in men's 57kg freestyle wrestling event, India wrestler Aman Sehrawat said his target was to bring gold medal. "My target for the 2028 Olympics is gold," he stated. "Everything on the court, went as per our plan," he added.  Aman defeated Puerto Rico's Darian Cruz with a scoreline of 13-5.
title: Things went as per plan, target for 2028 is gold: Aman on bronze

content: Track and field athlete Arshad Nadeem was mobbed by fans and paparazzi as he arrived at the Pakistani embassy in Paris after winning gold in the Men's javelin throw final in the Olympics. In a video surfaced on social media, fans were desperately trying to take pictures with the 27-year-old as he tried to enter the embassy.
title: Arshad Nadeem mobbed by fans outside Pakistani embassy in Paris

content: Ricky Ponting has expressed interest in coaching opportunities in the IPL after he parted ways with Delhi Capitals last month. "I'd love to coach again in the IPL. I've had a great time every year I've been involved," Ponting said on the ICC Review. He also acknowledged that the lack of a title led to his exit from the franchise.
title: I would love to coach again in the IPL: Ricky Ponting

content: Mohamed Elsayed has been arrested for an alleged sexual attack during the Paris Olympics 2024. The Egyptian wrestler was in a local cafe where he groped a customer's buttocks. It is being claimed that an inquiry has been set to deal with the incident. The Egyptian Olympic Committe (EOC) claimed that there would be a disciplinary hearing.
title: Mohamed Elsayed gets arrested for alleged sexual assault

content: Algerian boxer Imane Khelif has issued a strong statement, hitting back at her detractors after striking gold in the women's 66 kg Boxing event in the Paris 2024 Olympics. The 25-year-old declared that she is a woman and that the win gives her a special taste, given it has come in the face of all the criticism.
title: Imane Khelif hits back at critics after winning Olympic gold

content: Spain had to do it the hard way, but they were able to get the job done as they clinched a 5-3 win in extra-time over hosts, France, at the Paris Olympics 2024. They have now won their second gold medal in football throughout Olympics history. The last time Spain won a medal in this sport was back in 1992.
title: Spain clinch gold medal in thrilling 5-3 win over France

content: Indian fast bowler Mohammad Shami is reportedly expected to make his return to the national team during the Test series against Bangladesh in September this year. After getting sidelined from international cricket due to an ankle injury last year, the Amroha-born cricketer has made considerable progress in his recovery phase after undergoing surgery on his Achilles tendon.
title: Shami expected to make India return versus Bangladesh: Reports

content: During the ninth minute of stoppage time, Berger dove to save Alexia Putellas' effort at a penalty, then raised her hands in triumph. Putellas broke down in tears as the game concluded. Germany won the match thanks to a penalty kick converted by Giulia Gwinn in the second half. It was Germany's fourth Olympic bronze medal in women's soccer.
title: Berger saves last minute penalty to win bronze medal for Germany

content: Warner Bros. Discovery has completely shut down the Cartoon Network website, redirecting visitors to a landing page on Max, its subscription streaming service. "Looking for episodes of your favourite Cartoon Network shows? Check out what's available to stream on Max (subscription required)," a pop-up message said on the landing page. Cable subscribers can continue watching Cartoon Network on TVs.
title: Cartoon Network website shuts down

content: Susan Wojcicki, the former CEO of YouTube, passed away aged 56 after battling cancer for two years. Expressing grief over her death, Google CEO Sundar Pichai wrote, "Unbelievably saddened by the loss of my dear friend...It's hard to imagine the world without her." Her husband Dennis Troper said, "We are heartbroken, but grateful for the time we had with her."
title: Former YouTube CEO Susan Wojcicki passes away due to cancer at 56

content: Google and Meta teamed up for Instagram ads on YouTube aimed at targeting teenagers, as per a The Financial Times report. Meta is reportedly promoting Instagram ads to users aged between 13 and 17 years on YouTube, despite Google's policy prohibiting personalised ads for users aged under 18 years. Ads are part of Meta's broader efforts at retaining younger users.
title: Google and Meta teamed up for ads targeting teens: Report

content: A 24-year-old Canadian man has sued social media platforms including Instagram, TikTok & YouTube for ruining his productivity by being "too addictive". The man claims that he has also developed negative views towards his body image due to the platforms' addiction. Lawyers representing the man said the platforms are designed to increase dopamine secretion and get users addicted.
title: Canadian man sues Instagram & TikTok for ruining his productivity

content: Hackers are exploiting a vulnerability known as '0.0.0.0 Day'. Researchers at Oligo Security explained that public websites can communicate with local network services using the IP address 0.0.0.0. However, hackers are taking advantage of this bug by sending malicious requests to their target's 0.0.0.0 IP address, which enables them to collect data that should have been private, researchers said.
title: What is the '0.0.0.0 Day' bug being exploited by hackers?

content: India's G20 Sherpa Amitabh Kant, while talking about AI, said "The curriculum in IITs, IIMs and IIITs is still very outdated. It needs to be...radically realigned for the world of today." "You're producing engineers but they're not skilled to be AI engineers, data scientists or machine learners," he stated.  Colleges aren't producing people skilled for the startup movement, he added.
title: IIT, IIM curriculum outdated, needs radical change: Amitabh Kant

content: Delhites will soon receive traffic challans via WhatsApp as the local traffic police implement an AI-enabled system for automatic number plate recognition. This initiative, directed by L-G VK Saxena, aims to enhance traffic management by automatically detecting violations and issuing challans without human intervention.
title: AI-powered traffic challans to be issued on WhatsApp by Delhi cops

content: Fresh off its public market debut, EV major Ola Electric is now gearing up for the launch of its electric bike on Independence Day. “Ready to witness the future of motorcycling? It’s coming sooner than you think. Be there on 15th August at Sankalp 2024 for the grand reveal,” said the company’s official handle in a post on X.
title: Ola Electric teases launch of electric bike on August 15

content: Sriharsha Majety, the Group CEO of Swiggy, said quick commerce services can't take away market share from kiranas. "Kirana stores are more about top-up purchases. They sell sachets...which aren't sold by quick commerce companies. The user base is different," he said. He added that those shopping via quick commerce didn't majorly use to shop from kiranas.
title: Quick commerce not taking away share from kiranas: Swiggy's Majety

content: Karnataka IT Minister Priyank Kharge said the state government will launch a programme that will give ₹25,000 monthly for a year to those who quit jobs to become an entrepreneur. "It's a small amount considering the...inflation, but...we'll ensure...domestic expenses are taken care of," he stated. He said the government will also become the first client for startups in disruptive technologies.
title: K'taka to give ₹25,000/month to those quitting jobs for entrepreneurship

content: India's startup ecosystem thrives with over 1.4 lakh entities recognized by DPIIT as of June 2024, with 67,499 startups led by women. The Startup India initiative, launched in 2016, has fueled innovation, creating over 15.53 lakh direct jobs. Government schemes continue to support and enhance entrepreneurship nationwide.
title: India achieves 1.4 lakh startups milestone; 67,499 led by women

content: The US-based lenders of BYJU'S have moved the Supreme Court against the edtech startup's ₹158-crore settlement with BCCI. The settlement approved by NCLAT pulled BYJU'S out of an insolvency proceeding started by the cricket body. The lenders accuse BYJU'S of using money syphoned from them for the settlement. The apex court will hear the case on Monday.
title: BYJU'S US lenders move Supreme Court against BCCI settlement

content: Honasa Consumer, the parent entity of Mamaearth, posted a 62.9% jump in its profit after tax (PAT) to ₹40.2 crore in the June quarter (Q1) of the financial year 2024-25 from ₹24.7 crore in the same quarter of the previous year. The revenue from operations stood at ₹554 crore, higher by 19% over ₹464 crore posted in the year-ago period.
title: Mamaearth-parent's profit rises to ₹40 cr in Q1, revenue jumps 19%

content: Online classified company Info Edge reported a robust growth in its consolidated profits in the first quarter of the ongoing fiscal year (Q1 FY25). The company’s profit zoomed to ₹258.85 crore, a 75% year-on-year (YoY) increase from the ₹147.4 crore it made in Q1 FY24. Its expenses also jumped 7% YoY to ₹484.58 crore.
title: Info Edge Q1 net profits zoom 75% year-on-year to ₹258.85 crore

content: Google Cloud plans to establish a startup hub and centre of excellence in Madhya Pradesh, announced Chief Minister Mohan Yadav. He was speaking at an Invest Madhya Pradesh session in Bengaluru on August 8. As per CM Yadav, the state government received proposals worth nearly INR 3,200 Cr during the session.
title: Google to establish startup hub in Madhya Pradesh: CM Mohan Yadav

content: India's richest business families—Ambani, Bajaj, and Birla—have a combined net worth of over $460 billion, nearly matching Singapore's GDP, according to the 2024 Barclays Private Clients Hurun India report. The Ambani family leads with ₹25.75 lakh crore. The Adani family, valued at ₹15.45 lakh crore, is excluded due to first-generation criteria. Haldiram Snacks is the top unlisted company.
title: India's 3 richest business families together worth Singapore GDP

content: Kangana Ranaut urged everyone that they need to be ready to fight extremists and protect the nation amid the Bangladesh crisis. She said on X, "Pick your swords and keep them sharp. If not much give 10 mins to self-defence every day. Your submission to other weapons should not be a consequence of your incompetence in fighting."
title: Kangana raises voice against extremists amid Bangladesh crisis

content: Imran Khan recalled being caned in school as a child and said, "The regularity with which...teachers used to beat us had...started to get to me." "If I imagined...teacher today to...hit my child, I would see red," he said on 'We Are Yuvaa' YouTube channel, adding, "I'd be driven possibly to commit murder, to witness someone assaulting my child like that."
title: I could be driven to commit murder if teacher hits my child: Imran

content: Raveena Tandon revealed that she turned down the offer to star opposite Shah Rukh Khan as the film required her to wear costumes that were "really weird" and a "little too objectifying". "SRK said, 'Are you mad? Why are you saying no now?' I told him I can't wear that stuff...'I'll feel strange'," she said in a chat with Filmfare.
title: Rejected film with SRK due to objectifying costumes: Raveena

content: Adele has confirmed her engagement to partner Rich Paul. The singer made the announcement during a Germany concert. Adele, responding to a fan's marriage proposal during the concert, said, "I can't marry you, I'm already getting married." Adele has been dating US sports agent Paul since 2021 and was previously married to Simon Konecki, with whom she shares a son.
title: Adele confirms engagement to Rich Paul after fan proposes to her at concert

content: Actor Vijay Kadam, famous for his work in the Marathi industry, has passed away, actor Ajinkya Deo confirmed on Saturday. Kadam was battling cancer and was 67 years old, reports said. He passed away at his home. He had worked in theatre and in movies like 'Tere Mere Sapne', 'Irasaal Karti', 'De Danadan', and 'Hum Do Bundlebaaz'.
title: Actor Vijay Kadam dies of cancer aged 67

content: Rajkummar Rao said that he would have done Hansal Mehta's 2012 directorial 'Shahid' differently today. "I don't know better or not, but different for sure," he added. "You...grow as a human being. What I was 10 years back when I did Shahid and today I have more experience as a person...I'm way more mature in my thought process," Rajkummar said.
title: Would've done it differently today: Rajkummar on Hansal's 'Shahid'

content: On Saturday, Arjun Rampal took to his social media handle to share that his X account has been hacked. Rampal wrote, "Not good news, my X account has been hacked. Please don't respond to any tweets or messages. #accounthacked." He was last seen in Aditya Datt's film, Crakk: Jeetegaa Toh Jiyegaa, alongside Vidyut Jammwal, Nora Fatehi and Amy Jackson.
title: Arjun Rampal's X account hacked, asks fans to ignore messages

content: Actor Sidharth Malhotra and model Alicia Kaur set the ramp on fire with their bold act during a fashion event in Delhi. Their chemistry has created quite a buzz on the internet. In the videos, Sidharth is seen holding her close. Alicia also playfully pulled Sidharth by his collar. Sharing a video on Instagram, the model wrote, "Sorry Kiara."
title: Model apologises to Kiara after bold ramp walk with Sidharth

content: A Sweden-based Uyghur rights group, the Swedish Uyghur Committee, urged global action against China's genocide in East Turkistan. The group highlighted China's Belt and Road Initiative as a cover for occupation and called on Sweden and the international community to lead efforts to hold China accountable for its human rights abuses.
title: Swedish Uyghur Committee demands global action on China’s genocide

content: Shujun Wang, a 75-year-old US citizen, was sentenced to up to 25 years in prison for spying for China. Wang, a pro-democracy activist, secretly collected information on dissidents in the US and reported it to China's Ministry of State Security. The FBI's investigation uncovered his espionage activities.
title: Chinese-American sentenced to 25 years for spying for Beijing

content: The Iranian Revolutionary Guards have added new cruise missiles to their navy fleet, equipped with highly explosive, undetectable warheads. According to the semi-official Tasnim News Agency, these advanced missiles can cause extensive damage and sink their targets, marking a significant boost in Iran's military capabilities.
title: Iranian Navy unveils missiles with explosive warheads: Report

content: The Madras High Court quashed the detention order against YouTuber Savukku Shankar under the Goondas Act, passed by the Chennai Police on May 12. Shankar was arrested for allegedly making defamatory remarks against women police officials. The Supreme Court granted him interim relief in July, pending the court's decision.
title: Madras HC quashes Savukku Shankar's detention order

content: The Delhi High Court has scheduled an August 12 hearing for former IAS officer Puja Khedkar's plea challenging the denial of anticipatory bail. Khedkar is accused of identity fraud to gain extra attempts in the UPSC exam. The court stressed the need for thorough investigation into the alleged conspiracy and possible insider involvement.
title: Delhi HC sets August 12 for Puja Khedkar's bail hearing

content: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif has been criticised for his message to hail Arshad Nadeem following the javelin thrower's historic gold in the Paris 2024 Olympics. Sharif's criticism comes due to posting a picture with Nadeem of him presenting the athlete with a cheque of PKR 10 lakh, with the netizens accusing him of flaunting.
title: Shehbaz Sharif slammed for his post on X for Arshad Nadeem

content: A woman in China got her husband's life support turned off allegedly as revenge for his infidelity. The 38-year-old husband from Liaoning province had been living with his mistress abandoning his wife. He has been committing infidelity for over ten years. The woman's action has instigated a debate on the internet.
title: Woman turns off husband's life support as 'revenge' for infidelity

content: Pakistan's Shaheens cricket team couldn't hold back but celebrate track and field athlete Arshad Nadeem's gold medal in the men's javelin throw final in the Paris 2024 Olympics. The likes of Sarfaraz Ahmed, Umar Gul, and Mohammad Huraira were seen cheering for Nadeem in their hotel room as a video of the same emerged on social media.
title: Pakistan Shaheens cricket team celebrates Nadeem's victory

content: Bangladesh Chief Justice Obaidul Hassan said he agreed to resign "in principle", AFP reported on Saturday. His decision came after hundreds of protesters including students gheraoed the Supreme Court of Bangladesh and gave him a 1 pm deadline to resign. "They are trying to use the Supreme Court...to declare the interim government illegal," a protestor told local media.
title: Bangladesh Chief Justice Hassan to resign after protestors give him a deadline

content: An aircraft with 57 passengers and four crew members crashed in São Paulo, Brazil, killing all on board. The crash left flaming wreckage in a residential neighbourhood. "I thought it might have fallen on my house, with my son inside," one eyewitness told AFP. Another resident recalled, "I went out on the balcony and saw the plane spinning."
title: Thought it could fall on my home: Eyewitness on Brazil plane crash

content: The British government has informed victims of historic miscarriages of justice, including Andrew Malkinson, that they must now cover "bed and board" costs for time spent in prison. Malkinson, who was wrongfully jailed for 17 years, will see £100,000 (₹1 crore) deducted from his compensation. This new ruling reverses a previous policy, adding further financial strain on victims.
title: UK man wrongly jailed for 17 yrs ordered to pay ₹1cr boarding fees

content: A 27-year-old Israeli citizen died due to a malfunctioning Iron Dome interceptor missile. The missile reportedly missed a drone fired by Hezbollah and exploded on a highway, where the man was travelling. He was critically injured by shrapnel from the interceptor impact and died during treatment. Notably, Iron Dome is Israel's missile system designed to protect against incoming short-range threats.
title: Israeli missile launched to attack Hezbollah drone kills own citizen

content: Former US President Donald Trump's plane bound to Bozeman was diverted to Billings on Friday due to a mechanical issue, according to CBS News. The nature of the technical snag remains unconfirmed. The aircraft "landed without incident," and Trump later departed for Bozeman on another private jet ahead of his scheduled rally in Montana.
title: Trump's jet faces technical snag, diverted ahead of Montana rally

content: Tensions within the royal family are rising as Prince Harry is set to inherit $8.5 million from a trust fund established by the late Queen Mother. Prince William and Kate Middleton are reportedly upset by the windfall, deepening the rift between the brothers as Harry's financial independence continues to grow.
title: Prince Harry to get $8.5 million royal inheritance

content: Air India has suspended flights to and from Tel Aviv indefinitely due to escalating tensions between Israel and Iran. The airline is prioritizing the safety of passengers and crew, offering full refunds and waivers on rescheduling and cancellation charges. The situation is being closely monitored by Air India.
title: Air India halts Tel Aviv flights amid rising Middle East tensions

content: At least 200 dealers are protesting at Hero Electric's Gurugram headquarters, seeking dues worth ₹500 crore which they claim the EV-maker hasn't paid in past two years. "Some of the dealers [even] attempted suicide because they're in huge debt," one of the protesting dealers said. "We urged them to pay...half the dues, even a quarter...They simply refused," the dealer added.
title: 200 dealers protest at Hero Electric HQ, seek ₹500-crore dues

content: Supercar Blondie - top global auto reviewer, featured her first Indian brand: Ultraviolette F77, which claims to be India's fastest electric motorcycle, soon hitting Europe. Designed in Bengaluru by aviation industry experts, the video shows the bike racing an RC jet before being submerged in the world's deepest man-made pool (200ft), highlighting its tech & performance in extreme conditions.
title: 1st Indian bike on Supercar Blondie, the Ultraviolette F77, races a jet

content: Maruti Suzuki has announced a recall of 2,555 Alto K10 cars over a suspected defect in the steering gearbox assembly that could affect the vehicle's steerability. Customers of the affected vehicles have been asked not to use the car till the part is replaced. The automaker said it is contacting affected owners to conduct a voluntary check for the issue.
title: Maruti Suzuki recalls 2,555 Alto K10 cars over steering issue

content: An electric scooter owner was billed ₹8,000 for maintenance despite no significant damage, citing wear and tear on parts like the electric motor and pulleys. The scooter, four years old with 13,398 kilometre, faced unexpected high costs. The owner's frustration grew as attempts to secure a company service pack, which would have reduced expenses, failed.
title: Electric scooter owner gets ₹8,000 servicing bill

content: Hyundai Creta was India's top-selling car in July 2024 with the sale of 17,350 units. Maruti Suzuki Swift secured the second spot with sales of 16,854 units, followed by Maruti Suzuki Wagon R (16,191), Tata Punch (16,121), Maruti Suzuki Ertiga (15,701), Maruti Suzuki Brezza (14,676), Tata Nexon (13,902), Mahindra Scorpio (12,237), Maruti Suzuki Eeco (11,916) and Maruti Suzuki Dzire (11,647).
title: Which were India's 10 best-selling cars in July?

content: A US man died on Monday after his Tesla Cybertruck crashed in Texas. The Cybertruck lost control, crashed into a concrete culvert before bursting into flames, leaving just a shell of the car remaining, officials said. US National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) said it is seeking more information about the incident from the Elon Musk-led EV maker.
title: US man dies after Cybertruck loses control, catches fire; probe on

content: Former US President Donald Trump praised Tesla CEO Elon Musk after YouTuber Adin Ross gifted him a Cybertruck wrapped in the 'raised fist' photograph taken after his assassination attempt. "Elon you are great...you are really good," Trump can be heard as saying during a livestream. Notably, Musk has publicly endorsed Trump in the US Presidential race.
title: Elon, you are really good: Trump after being gifted Cybertruck

content: YouTuber Adin Ross gifted a Tesla Cybertruck wrapped in the 'raised fist' photograph to ex-US President Donald Trump. The picture was clicked when 20-year-old Thomas Matthew Crooks shot at Trump during an election rally and Trump raised his fist while being escorted to safety. Tesla CEO Elon Musk reacted to an image of Trump near the Cybertruck with fire emojis.
title: YouTuber gifts Cybertruck with 'raised fist' pic to Trump, Musk reacts

content: Ola Electric, aiming to create a comprehensive electric two-wheeler ecosystem, is advancing towards its goal with an IPO that opened on August 2. The company received 35% of bids on the first day and plans to raise approximately Rs 6,145.56Cr. This milestone is expected to bolster Ola's position as a leader in India's EV revolution and benefit the entire industry.
title: Ola electric’s IPO: Boosting India’s EV ambitions

content: Scientists aboard an ocean drilling vessel have drilled 4,160 feet, the deepest so far into Earth's mantle beneath the Atlantic seabed, retrieving a significant rock sample. This cylindrical core sample is shedding light on the mantle's composition and its interactions with seawater. These processes may have played crucial role in the emergence of life on Earth billions of years ago.
title: Scientists dig deepest hole in Earth's mantle, obtain rock sample

content: Scientists have reported the discovery of India's first indigenous methane-eating bacteria, known as methanotrophs, in rice fields and wetlands in Western India. The team isolated and described a novel genus and species of methanotrophs, named Methylocucumis oryzae. Methane, the second most important greenhouse gas, has 26 times more global warming potential than carbon dioxide.
title: India's 1st methane-eating bacteria discovered

content: A 10,000-year-old giant panda fossil has been discovered in a limestone cave in Shaanxi Province, China. The remarkably well-preserved fossil includes over 90% of the skull and 70% of the skeleton, a rare find according to researchers. The fossil was found 180 metres deep in a cave in Chenggu County, Hanzhong City, resting on a limestone platform.
title: 10,000-yr-old giant panda fossil found in limestone cave in China

content: China's Long March 6A rocket broke apart after successfully launching 18 satellites, creating over 300 pieces of trackable debris in low Earth orbit, US Space Command stated. The satellites are part of China's planned Qianfan broadband network, similar to Elon Musk's Starlink. After delivering satellites at 800 km altitude, the rocket's upper stage disintegrated, resulting in a cloud of debris.
title: China's rocket breaks into 300 parts after launching 18 satellites

content: A series of powerful solar events is expected to trigger significant geomagnetic storms on Earth in the coming days. Three coronal mass ejections (CMEs), including a potent one from an X1.3-class solar flare on August 8, are en route. The combined impact could elevate geomagnetic storm levels to category G3, potentially disrupting satellites, communications, and power grids.
title: Satellites, power grids at risk as geomagnetic storm to hit Earth

content: Since mid-July, ground temperatures in Antarctica were recorded 10 degrees Celsius higher than normal. Some parts also recorded -25 to -30 degrees Celsius temperatures as opposed to -50 to -60 degrees Celsius deep-winter temperatures. Scientists say a weakening polar vortex, that keeps cold air trapped, is causing this. The reduction in extent of Antarctic sea ice is also a factor.
title: What are the reasons driving 'deep-winter heatwave' in Antarctica?

content: Scientists propose sprinkling engineered dust particles in Mars' atmosphere to warm the planet, potentially making it habitable for humans. This approach is part of broader efforts to terraform Mars, currently an inhospitable environment with extreme cold, deadly UV rays, and thin air. According to University of Chicago study, this method is over 5,000 times more efficient than previous ideas.
title: Engineered dust can be sprinkled on Mars to make it liveable: Study

content: ESA's Gaia mission, originally intended for star mapping, has identified potential moons around over 350 asteroids, significantly expanding our knowledge of binary asteroid systems. Despite expectations that nearly one-sixth of asteroids have companions, only 500 of the million known asteroids have been confirmed. This discovery could nearly double the number of known asteroid moons.
title: New moons orbiting 350 asteroids discovered by ESA's Gaia mission

content: ICON's Vulcan printer is finalising the world's largest 3D-printed neighbourhood with 100 homes in Georgetown, Texas. Begun in November 2022, the project boasts faster, cheaper, and sustainable construction. Homeowners praise the resilience and insulation of the walls. Prices range from $450,000 to $600,000. ICON aims to use this technology for lunar structures in the future.
title: World’s largest 3D-printed neighbourhood nears completion in Texas

content: Mehrangarh Fort, a sandstone structure perched on a hill overlooking Jodhpur, is the perfect example of Rajasthan's regal past and architectural prowess. The fortifications of this structure rise to 120 feet, and are spread across an area of 1,200 acres. Inside the fort are numerous palaces, which were residences of the king and queens, now part of the museum.
title: Mehrangarh fort in Jodhpur is a photographer’s delight

content: Built by the Mughal emperor Shah Jahan in the 17th century, Red Fort became Mughal Sultanate's epicentre. For the British, it was a symbol of India's Revolt of 1857; they tried to destroy it, and almost did. But today, the fort is a symbol of India's sovereignty and unity, and has since 1947, been the venue for Independence day celebrations.
title: All about Red Fort, venue for PM’s Independence Day speech

content: Dark tourism invites visitors to confront the darker aspects of human history. From the haunting remnants of concentration camps like Auschwitz and the chilling desolation of Chernobyl to the solemn memorials of Hiroshima and the Killing Fields, these destinations offer a sobering perspective on human suffering, conflict, and disaster.
title: Haunting 'Dark Tourism' sites from around the world

content: Osaka, a city pulsating with energy and rich in culture, offers a diverse array of attractions for every traveller. Explore iconic landmarks like Osaka Castle and Sumiyoshi Taisha Shrine, immerse yourself in the bustling energy of Dotonbori, and indulge in retail therapy at Shinsaibashi and Namba. For family fun, visit Universal Studios Japan or Tennoji Park.
title: Osaka's best experiences for your first trip to Japan

content: Located in the Bay of Bengal, the secluded North Sentinel Island is home to one of the last isolated tribes in the world. The Sentinelese have, for centuries, fended off all attempts of contact from the outside world. Anyone who has tried to bypass their desires has met a tragic end. Their island is also off-limits to travellers.
title: India is home to the most isolated tribe in the world

content: Often dubbed the 'strangest country in the world', Turkmenistan's capital is eerily empty, as a travel vlogger recently discovered. Jacob, who visited the country's capital Ashgabat, said "The city [Ashgabat] is full of these crazy lavish monuments, there is no traffic - malls, hotels are all empty so the question is where is everyone?"
title: A travel vlogger visited the 'world's strangest country'

content: Kolkata, the cultural capital of India, is a great starting point for exploring the diverse landscapes and experiences that the eastern part of the country offers. If you're looking to escape the city's hustle and bustle, you can look at coastal cities like Shankarpur and Mousuni, Bengal's canyon Gangani, tea estates of Raimatang or go birdwatching at Gajoldoba
title: Independence day long weekend: 5 getaways near Kolkata

content: India's palaces are a testament to centuries of opulence and architectural brilliance. While they are stunning year-round, the monsoon season adds a unique charm, transforming these majestic structures into ethereal havens. Think destinations like City Palace in Jaipur and City Palace in Udaipur, Sajjangarh Monsoon Palace on the outskirts of Udaipur, as well as the stunning Mysore Palace
title: 5 palaces in India that are most beautiful during monsoon

content: A policeman repeatedly hit a woman with a baton as she fought with her husband in front of the police station in Telangana's Karimnagar on Saturday. The woman's family has alleged that the head constable misbehaved with her and demanded strict action against the two policemen seen in the video.
title: Cop hits woman with baton at police station in Telangana

content: In a shocking incident of mistreatment, Anganwadi students were served eggs, their videos were recorded and then the eggs were taken away from their plates in Karnataka. Lakshmi, an Anganwadi worker, and Shainaja Begum, a helper, have been suspended following suspicions of fraud in the distribution of eggs to Anganwadi children.
title: Eggs served to students during meal, taken back after photo-op

content: Doom scrolling is the act of spending excessive time online to read particularly negative news items. According to psychological counsellor Piyusha Samant, doom scrolling can desensitise people to tragic events. "One can lose emotionality," she said. It can also lead to or worsen disorders like antisocial personality disorder, mania and bipolar disorder and also cause hormonal imbalance.
title: What are the negative effects of 'doom scrolling'?

content: Eldest Daughter Syndrome is a psychological phenomenon where the eldest daughter assumes certain level of responsibility in the family, said relationship counsellor Ruchi Ruuh. It can contribute to strong leadership qualities and determination for success. However, it can also lead to challenges in interpersonal relationships, such as difficulty expressing vulnerability and prioritising self-care.
title: What is Eldest Daughter Syndrome?

content: 'Tolyamory' is a portmanteau deriving from the words 'tolerate' and 'polyamory'. It was coined by relationship columnist Dan Savage. The term refers to a relationship dynamic in which one or both partners tolerate the other's outside sexual or romantic contact. Unlike polyamory and other forms of consensual non-monogamy, it's not something the couple has explicitly discussed and agreed to.
title: What is 'tolyamory', a new dating trend?

content: In a horrific incident in Firozabad, a man allegedly tied his wife with a rope and repeatedly tortured and beat her with a stick. The accused also inserted a wooden rolling pin inside his wife's private parts. Although the woman was rushed to a nearby hospital, doctors declared her dead on arrival. The accused has been arrested.
title: Man held for inserting rolling pin inside wife in Firozabad

content: A woman thrashed a drunk man with a slipper after he attacked her and her husband in Uttar Pradesh's Greater Noida on Friday. According to reports, after the accused misbehaved with the couple, the husband chased him on a bike. Upon catching up with him, he started thrashing the man, leading to a fight between them.
title: Woman hits drunk man with slipper as he attacked her in Gr Noida

content: The UP police arrested a man named Kuldeep who is accused of committing serial murders in Bareilly. Before Kuldeep's arrest, the police had released a sketch of the suspect. A "serial killer", Kuldeep is accused of killing nine women of similar profile in the past fourteen months. During the investigation, cops found that all victims were strangulated to death.
title: Man accused of killing 9 women in Bareilly arrested

content: In a tragic incident, a Scorpio lost control and rammed into several people standing on the side of a highway killing one and injuring four others in Andhra Pradesh's Narasapuram on Wednesday. As per reports, the incident took place when the car coming into Narasapuram from Sitaramapuram lost control near the Anjaneyaswamy temple.
title: One killed as car loses control near Andhra Pradesh highway

content: Punjab Agri-Business Incubator (PABI) has announced a new initiative designed to foster innovation and technological progress among students in agriculture and related fields. The initiative offers substantial financial and technical backing to selected students, with each recipient eligible for a one-time grant of up to ₹4 lakh. The application deadline is August 19, 2024.
title: PABI offers ₹4 lakh grants for agri-innovators
